main event: A light object observed in Dayton, Ohio on August 13, 1959, described as the size of a grapefruit, revolving with an indefinite outline, and disappearing suddenly.
interesting points: The object was reported by civilian witnesses,Two other witnesses described the object as similar to a weather balloon,Observation lasted between 10-15 minutes,The object disappeared suddenly by 'blinking out',The investigation concluded it was probably a balloon released by the US Weather Bureau.
witness description: civilian witnesses, two of whom compared it to a weather balloon
